Using external software packages

The table below lists a number of external software packages that the usage of McStas can benefit from. The McStas compiler itself as well as the simulations generated by it are fully functional without any external software (apart from an ANSI-C compiler). But the front-end programs that enhance the simulations with additional functionality require additional software, as detailed in the table.

Note that some or all of this software may be included with your system. For example, the Debian GNU/Linux operating system includes all of the software mentioned below (though not all of it is installed by default). Check the documentation for your particular system for details. Also check out our page of tested platforms.

Needed support packages for the graphical user interface:


 
Package Description Links
Perl Scripting language used by front-end programs. You need this if you want to use any of the front-end programs. Home page
Tk Graphic widgets used for the front-end programs. Home page
Perl/Tk Perl interface to the Tk graphical user interface toolkit. You need to obtain this is you want to use the mcgui graphical user interface front-end. Home page
